com.ologicinc.rostango.TangoNodes.depth

Class DepthViewSurface

  • java.lang.Object
    • SurfaceView
      • com.ologicinc.rostango.TangoNodes.depth.DepthViewSurface
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RosDepthViewSurface

    public class DepthViewSurface
extends SurfaceView
    DepthViewSurface is the surface that the camera object uses to draw the image and depth data on. The Camera object returns a superframe with each onPreview callback as the 'data' parameter. The 'SuperFrame' contain image data and depth data (and other data as well). The depth data corresponds to the image data in x,y space (although the depth data is at a lower resolution). An easy way to map the visible image to the lower resolution depth buffer is to scale the depth buffer by 4x. This means both buffers will be 1280 x 720. Alternately scale the visible image by 1/4x so both buffers are 320 x 180. In this app the depth data is used to draw false color images that overlay the cameras visible image.
    Author:
    Michael F. Winter (robotmikew@gmail.com)
